translated: Therefore, if the Saṅgha is ready, it should grant permission for the monk Kāśyapa, who is old, aged, and decrepit,

original: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba gsol na /
translated: and for the monk Śāriputra, who has a wind illness, not to be separated from his patched robe.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong 'od srungs rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong 'od srungs rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa'am /
translated: Venerables, if you are ready, then grant permission for the monk Kāśyapa, who is old, aged, and decrepit,🔽and for the monk Śāriputra, who has a wind illness, not to be separated from his patched robe.

original: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun
analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun
translated: The Saṅgha has tolerated and agreed to🔽the Saṅgha

original: gyis dge slong 'od srungs rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gyis dge slong 'od srungs rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa'am /
translated: granting permission to the elder monk Kāśyapa, who is old and decrepit,

original: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal lags te /
analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu rlung nad can la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal lags te /
translated: and to the monk Śāriputra, who has a wind illness, not to be separated from his outer robe.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there is no objection, this is accepted as it is.

original: de ni rgan po 'am nad pa la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni rgan po 'am nad pa la snam sbyar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and the action for granting permission to an elder or an invalid not to be separated from his outer robe.

original: lo drug tu 'chang ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na mi 'dod bzhin du lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lo drug tu 'chang ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas dge slong gis stan sar pa byed na mi 'dod bzhin du lo drug tu bcang bar bya'o //
translated: In the chapter on the relinquishment of the six-year keeping, it is said: “If a monk makes a new sitting mat, he should keep it for six years, even if he does not want to.”

original: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du stan rnying pa de spangs kyang rung /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis lo drug tshun chad du stan rnying pa de spangs kyang rung /
translated: If a monk discards his old mat within six years,

original: ma spangs kyang stan sar pa gzhan byed na /
analyzed: ma spangs kyang stan sar pa gzhan byed na /
translated: or if he makes a new one without discarding the old one,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: then, unless the saṅgha has given permission, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ni dge slong lag gi @152b bla gang la lo drug du stan gyis mi thub pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol ba de la dge 'dun gyis lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi🔽gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ni dge slong lag gi @152b bla gang la lo drug du stan gyis mi thub pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol ba de la dge 'dun gyis lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “The saṅgha gives permission” means that if a monk is not able to use his mat for six years, then that monk should request permission from the saṅgha to use a mat for six years. The saṅgha should give permission to use a mat for six years.

original: dge slong lag gi bla gang la lo drug tu stan gyis mi thub pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla gang la lo drug tu stan gyis mi thub pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk is not able to use his mat for six years, then that monk should request permission from the saṅgha to use a mat for six years.

original: 'di ltar gsol bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsol bar bya ste /
translated: He should make his request as follows:

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
translated: “The bedding should be laid out. The gaṇḍī should be struck.

original: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: Having instructed the monks with the words of the question,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong lag gi bla des bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgan rims la phyag 'tshal nas rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong lag gi bla des bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgan rims la phyag 'tshal nas rgan pa'i mtha' logs su tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas /
translated: when the entire saṅgha is gathered and in agreement, that monk who is the senior of the senior monks, having arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, having bowed down to the senior monks, having sat down on his haunches, having raised his joined palms,

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /🔽bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las ;
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las ;
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!🔽I, the monk named so-and-so, who is the senior of the senior monks, have not used a sitting mat for six years.

original: bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, who is the senior of the senior monks, am requesting permission from the saṅgha to use a sitting mat for six years.

original: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba stsal du gsol ;
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba stsal du gsol ;
translated: “Venerable monks, out of compassion, please grant me, the monk named so-and-so, permission to use a seat for up to six years.”

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: Repeat this three times.

original: de ni lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de ni lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request for permission to use a seat for up to six years.

original: de dge slong de dag gis dge slong lag gi bla de la dad pa'am yid ches pas 'gro ba mi bya bar dge 'dun thams cad de 'dong bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de dge slong de dag gis dge slong lag gi bla de la dad pa'am yid ches pas 'gro ba mi bya bar dge 'dun thams cad de 'dong bar bya ba'am /
translated: The monks should not go to the monk named so-and-so out of faith or trust in him. The entire saṅgha should go there,

original: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i dge slong dag gtang bar bya zhing de dag gis stan de rang gi mig sngar bab par bya ba'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i dge slong dag gtang bar bya zhing de dag gis stan de rang gi mig sngar bab par bya ba'am /
translated: or monks appointed by the saṅgha should go there. They should bring the seat into their presence,

original: yang na stan de dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na stan de dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: or they should bring the seat into the middle of the saṅgha.

original: gal te stan de ha cang ring ba yin na de de dag gis gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te stan de ha cang ring ba yin na de de dag gis gcad par bya'o //
translated: If the seat is too long, they should cut it down.

original: gal te ha cang thung ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ha cang thung ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If it is too short, he should give wool.

original: gal te ha cang yangs ba yin na de dag gis gcad par bya'o //🔽gal te ha cang dog pa yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ha cang yangs ba yin na de dag gis gcad par bya'o // gal te ha cang dog pa yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If it is too wide, they should cut it down.🔽If it is too tight, he should give wool.

original: gal te ral ba dang rdol ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ral ba dang rdol ba yin na bal sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If it has holes or tears, he should give wool.

original: de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //
translated: That is the first time.

original: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang bcos dka' ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi thams cad du bug rdol dang sha zad pa dang bcos dka' ba nyid yin na /
translated: If it is completely torn, worn out, or difficult to repair,

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong @153a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong @153a * //
translated: then a second monk

original: gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: should make a proposal and perform the rite.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It is done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, he should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong lag gi bla ma'i 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla ma'i 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa las dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
translated: This monk Hastabala has not had a mat for six years. This monk Hastabala is asking the Saṅgha for permission to use a mat for up to six years.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol to ;
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol to ;
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, the Saṅgha should agree to give the monk named So-and-so permission to use a mat for six years.

original: /'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: /'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /🔽dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa la /🔽dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol te /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tu stan mi bgyid pa la / dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun las lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol te /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!🔽This monk named So-and-so is not to use a mat for six years.🔽This monk named So-and-so is asking the Saṅgha for permission to use a mat for six years.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba gsol na /
translated: For that purpose, the Saṅgha is asking the monk named So-and-so for permission to use a mat for six years.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge
translated: If the saṅgha accepts that the monk named so-and-so be given permission to use a mat for six years, it will remain silent.🔽If it does not accept, it should speak.

original: 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal lags te /
analyzed: 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong lag gi bla ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lo drug tshun chad du stan gnang ba stsal lags te /
translated: The saṅgha has accepted and given permission to the monk named so-and-so to use a mat for six years.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there are no objections, this will stand.

original: de ni dge slong lag gi bla stan med pa la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni dge slong lag gi bla stan med pa la lo drug tshun chad du stan gyi gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual for giving permission to a monk who has no mat to use a mat for six years.

original: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang rang gi lag gis gser dang dngul len nam len du 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: gser dngul la reg pa'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang rang gi lag gis gser dang dngul len nam len du 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: “If a monk himself takes gold and silver or has it taken, he commits a pāyantika.”

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought:

original: kye ma bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag kyang gos kyi rin dag sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: kye ma bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag kyang gos kyi rin dag sbyin par byed la /
translated: “Alas! Faithful brahmins and householders give the cost of robes.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyang dgos kyi rin dag 'dod kyis /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyang dgos kyi rin dag 'dod kyis /
translated: My disciples want the cost of robes.

original: ngas nyan thos rnams la rung bar bya ba cung zad gnang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ngas nyan thos rnams la rung bar bya ba cung zad gnang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: I will allow my disciples to accept a little.”

original: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He said, “You may accept it. Having accepted it, you should keep it with confidence in that donor.

original: gzhan @153b yang dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan @153b yang dge slong gi zhal ta byed pa spro bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should be enthusiastic about serving the monks.🔽Moreover, a monk may accept it. Having accepted it, he should consecrate it in the presence of a monk.”

original: gzhan yang dge slong gis blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang dge slong gi mdun du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pas rung ba gsum bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gis blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang dge slong gi mdun du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pas rung ba gsum bka' stsal te /
translated: Thus he taught three kinds of permissible robes.

original: sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du mos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas len du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du mos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas len du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The master of the house should be made to imagine that he is the owner, and the manager should be made to agree that he is the owner.

original: de la rung ba dang po'i cho ga ni dge slong gis chos gos kyi zong rin po che dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rung ba dang po'i cho ga ni dge slong gis chos gos kyi zong rin po che dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The ritual for the first type of suitability is that when a monk obtains precious goods for the price of robes, he should accept them. Having accepted them, he should keep them with confidence in that very donor.

original: rung ba gnyis pa'i cho ga ni dge slong rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang cung zad ci rnyed pa de dag thams cad spyin bdag zhal te byed pas kun dga' ra ba'am /
analyzed: rung ba gnyis pa'i cho ga ni dge slong rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang cung zad ci rnyed pa de dag thams cad spyin bdag zhal te byed pas kun dga' ra ba'am /
translated: The ritual for the second type of suitability is that whatever unsuitable things the monks obtain for as long as they live, the manager should make the donor or the lay disciple happy.

original: dge bsnyen spro bar bya zhing de'i ming gis bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen spro bar bya zhing de'i ming gis bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should keep them with the name of that person.

original: rung ba gsum pa'i cho ga ni mi bzung bar mdun du bzhag nas dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba gsum pa'i cho ga ni mi bzung bar mdun du bzhag nas dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The ritual for the third type of suitability is that without keeping them, he should place them in front of the monk and stand in front of him and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /🔽bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di rnyed de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di rnyed de /
translated: “Venerable, please pay attention!🔽I, the monk named so-and-so, have obtained this unsuitable thing.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, consecrate this unsuitable thing.

original: dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: With this unsuitable thing I will obtain a suitable thing.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: ” Repeat this three times.

original: nyan pa'i dge slong gis thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i dge slong gis thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The listening monk should say, “It is a method.”

original: bdag nyid kyis legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should say, “It is good.”

original: rung ba de gsum gang byas kyang 'dra ste bdag gir bya ba med pas de la reg gam reg tu bcug na yang 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba de gsum gang byas kyang 'dra ste bdag gir bya ba med pas de la reg gam reg tu bcug na yang 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: It makes no difference which of the three suitable things he does. Since there is no ownership, if he touches it or has someone else touch it, he should not regret it.

original: de ni dngos po rung ba ma yin pa rung bar bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni dngos po rung ba ma yin pa rung bar bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the consecration mantra and ritual for making an unsuitable thing suitable.

original: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang lhung bzed lhan pa lnga med pa spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir lhung bzed sar pa gzhan tshol zhing lhung bzed grub na spang ba'i lhung byed do //
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang lhung bzed lhan pa lnga med pa spyad bzod pa yod bzhin du bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir lhung bzed sar pa gzhan tshol zhing lhung bzed grub na spang ba'i lhung byed do //
translated: A monk who has a bowl with less than five mends that is suitable for use, if he seeks another new bowl because he wants a better one, then when he has finished the bowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong des lhung bzed de dge slong gi 'khor la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des lhung bzed de dge slong gi 'khor la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: That monk should offer that bowl to the community of monks.

original: dge slong gi 'khor de'i lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong de la dge slong khyod kyis lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor de'i lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong de la dge slong khyod kyis lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya /
translated: The monk should give the bowl to that monk, saying, ‘Monk, you should not consecrate this bowl,

original: gtang bar mi bya /
analyzed: gtang bar mi bya /
translated: you should not give it away,

original: gzhan la @154a * //
analyzed: gzhan la @154a * //
translated: you should not give it to someone else.

original: sbyin par mi bya bar ma chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du khad kyis ngal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin par mi bya bar ma chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du khad kyis ngal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Until it has holes, you should use it carefully and gradually.’

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes gsungs pa'i zhar la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste ;
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes gsungs pa'i zhar la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste ;
translated: The Buddha said, “That is the procedure,” and as an aside, he said, “Appoint a monk to distribute the alms bowls.”🔽“The monk who distributes the alms bowls should not be appointed if he has five qualities:

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya la /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya la /
translated: if he is not appointed, he should not be appointed;

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: and if he is appointed, he should be removed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five qualities?

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa brims pa dang ma brims pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa brims pa dang ma brims pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: He goes because of desire, he goes because of ill will, he goes because of confusion, he goes because of fear, and he does not know whether the alms bowls have or have not been distributed.

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
translated: “The monk who distributes the alms bowls should be appointed if he has five qualities:

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: if he is appointed, he should not be removed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five qualities?

original: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang ; gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa brims pa dang ma brims pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang ; gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas mi 'gro ba dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa brims pa dang ma brims pa shes pa'o //
translated: He should not go out of desire, nor out of hatred, nor out of delusion, nor out of fear. He should know whether the alms-round has been done or not.

original: 'di ltar bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsko bar bya'o //
translated: This is how he should be appointed.

original: je dang po spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: je dang po spro bar bya ste /
translated: First he should be encouraged:

original: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge 'dun las lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge 'dun las lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Are you, so-and-so, able to do the alms-round for the saṅgha?”

original: gal te spro na des spro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te spro na des spro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he is able, he should say, “I am able.”

original: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: After that, he should prepare the seats and benches, ring the gong, and announce to the monks with a statement that includes the reason.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //🔽'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o // 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: When the whole saṅgha is present and agrees, a monk should make a proposal and do the procedure.🔽This is how it should be done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit down and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro na /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro na /
translated: If this monk named so-and-so is willing to carry the saṅgha’s unrelated alms-bowl,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par bsko'o //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par bsko'o //
translated: if the time has come for the saṅgha and it is acceptable to the saṅgha, then the saṅgha should agree to this. The saṅgha will appoint this monk named so-and-so to carry the saṅgha’s unrelated alms-bowl.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge @154b 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro ste /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge @154b 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro ste /
translated: This monk named so-and-so is willing to carry the saṅgha’s unrelated alms-bowl.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro na tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par spro na tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim
translated: Those who accept the appointment of the monk so-and-so to carry the monk so-and-so’s unrelated alms bowl should remain silent.🔽Those who do not accept it should speak.

original: par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa🔽'brim par bskos lags te /
analyzed: par bsko bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par bskos lags te /
translated: The saṅgha has accepted and agreed to appoint the monk so-and-so to carry the monk so-and-so’s unrelated alms bowl.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there are no objections, this is how it will be upheld.

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gi kun tu spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gi kun tu spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: “The monk who carries the unrelated alms bowl should act in the following way.

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun tshogs pa'i dus su dge 'dun la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par 'gyur gyis khyod cag nang par gand'i brdungs pa na rang rang gi
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun tshogs pa'i dus su dge 'dun la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang dge 'dun la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim par 'gyur gyis khyod cag nang par gand'i brdungs pa na rang rang gi
translated: ‘Venerables, tomorrow I will distribute the unrelated alms-bowls to the Saṅgha. You should bring your alms-bowls

original: lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: to the assembly of the Saṅgha at the sound of the gaṇḍī.’

original: de nas lhung bzed 'brel pa med na 'brim pa'i dge slong gis phyi de nyin bar gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
analyzed: de nas lhung bzed 'brel pa med na 'brim pa'i dge slong gis phyi de nyin bar gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
translated: Then, the next day, the monk who distributes the unrelated alms-bowls should prepare the seats, ring the gaṇḍī,

original: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: and announce to the monks with a statement.

original: dge slong rnams kyis kyang rang rang gi lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dag phyung zhing thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis kyang rang rang gi lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dag phyung zhing thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The monks should bring out and hold their consecrated alms-bowls and enter the assembly of the Saṅgha.

original: de nas lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa thogs te rgan pa'i mtha' logs su phyag 'tshal nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'brim pa'i dge slong gis dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa thogs te rgan pa'i mtha' logs su phyag 'tshal nas dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: Then, the monk who is distributing the unrelated alms bowls, in the presence of the saṅgha who are seated and in agreement, holding the unrelated alms bowl, having bowed at the feet of the most senior, sits in front of the saṅgha’s most senior monk.

original: gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba /
analyzed: gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba /
translated: “ Most senior, this alms bowl is very clear,

original: dbyibs legs pa ;
analyzed: dbyibs legs pa ;
translated: well-shaped,

original: longs spyod par bzod pa lags kyis gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa'i bsngags pa brjod de dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod par bzod pa lags kyis gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa'i bsngags pa brjod de dbul bar bya'o //
translated: and suitable for use. If you wish, take it.” In this way, having praised the qualities of the unrelated alms bowl, it should be offered.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis kyang gal te 'dod na blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis kyang gal te 'dod na blang bar bya'o //
translated: If the saṅgha’s most senior monk wishes, he should take it.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan @155a * //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan @155a * //
translated: If the saṅgha’s most senior monk

original: gyis lhung bzed de blangs na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis lhung bzed gang yin pa de gnas brtan gnyis pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gyis lhung bzed de blangs na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis lhung bzed gang yin pa de gnas brtan gnyis pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: takes that alms bowl, the alms bowl that is the saṅgha’s most senior monk’s should be offered to the second most senior monk.

original: gnas brtan gnyis pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de gnas brtan gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan gnyis pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de gnas brtan gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The contents of the bowl of the second most senior monk should be offered to the third most senior monk.

original: de bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gnyis pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la dbul ba'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gnyis pa'i lhung bzed gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la dbul ba'i bar du bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the contents of the bowl of the second most junior monk should be offered to the most junior monk.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ma blangs na gnas brtan gnyis pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ma blangs na gnas brtan gnyis pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If the most senior monk does not accept the offering, it should be offered to the second most senior monk.

original: gal te gnas brtan gnyis pas ma blangs na gnas brtan gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas brtan gnyis pas ma blangs na gnas brtan gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If the second most senior monk does not accept the offering, it should be offered to the third most senior monk.

original: gal te gnas brtan gsum pas blangs pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya zhing brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas brtan gsum pas blangs pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya zhing brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If the third most senior monk accepts the offering, the most senior monk should be asked to confess the offense of violating the rule. The offering should not be given to him on the first request, nor on the second.

original: brjod pa gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod pa gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: It should be given to him on the third request.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas kyi lhung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas kyi lhung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: The most senior monk should confess the offense of violating the rule.

original: de bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gsar du bu gsum pas ma blangs na gsar bu gnyis pa la 'bul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gsar du bu gsum pas ma blangs na gsar bu gnyis pa la 'bul bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, if the first novice monk does not accept it, it should be offered to the second novice monk.

original: gal te gsar bu gnyis pas ma blangs na gsar bu gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gsar bu gnyis pas ma blangs na gsar bu gsum pa la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If the second novice monk does not accept it, it should be offered to the third novice monk.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi gsar bus blangs pa na gsar bu gsum pa slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi gsar bus blangs pa na gsar bu gsum pa slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya zhing /
translated: If the novice monk accepts it, and the third novice monk requests it, it should not be given to him on the first request.

original: brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be given to him on the second request either.

original: brjod pa gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod pa gsum pa la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: It should be given to him on the third request.

original: dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gsum pas 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas kyi lhung ba bshags pa'i bar du bya'o//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gsar bu gsum pas 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas kyi lhung ba bshags pa'i bar du bya'o//
translated: The third novice monk should confess the offense of falling into wrongdoing that is in violation of the monastic code.🔽The last alms bowl of the assembly of monks should be given to that monk.

original: dge slong gi 'khor de'i lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong de la dge slong khyod kyi lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor de'i lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de dge slong de la dge slong khyod kyi lhung bzed 'di byin gyis brlab par mi bya /
translated: That monk should not consecrate that alms bowl.

original: gtang bar mi bya /
analyzed: gtang bar mi bya /
translated: He should not give it away.

original: gzhan la sbyin par mi bya bar chag pa'i mthar thug gi bar du khad kyis dal bus dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par mi bya bar chag pa'i mthar thug gi bar du khad kyis dal bus dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes sbyin par bya'o //
translated: He should not give it to anyone else, but should use it little by little, slowly, until it is worn out.

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'chang ba'i dge slong gi kun tu spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'chang ba'i dge slong gi kun tu spyad pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The monk who keeps a patched robe should follow these rules of proper conduct:

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'chang ba'i dge slong gis lhung bzed kyi snod gnyis nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'chang ba'i dge slong gis lhung bzed kyi snod gnyis nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The monk who keeps a patched robe should keep two alms bowls.

original: de la bzang po gang yin pa de lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing cig shos @155b su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bzang po gang yin pa de lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing cig shos @155b su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should put the better one in the patched robe and the other one in the bowl bag.

original: des lhung bzed gnyis ka thogs te bsod snyoms la 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: des lhung bzed gnyis ka thogs te bsod snyoms la 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: He should go for alms with both bowls.

original: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras chan skam po rnyed na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If he gets dry food, he should put it in the patched robe.

original: gal te 'bras chan gsher pa rnyed na lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras chan gsher pa rnyed na lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If he finds some rice gruel, he should take it with a consecrated alms-bowl.

original: gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas dkyil 'khor byas te /🔽lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa mdun du bzhag nas lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs par bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas dkyil 'khor byas te / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa mdun du bzhag nas lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs par bza' bar bya'o //
translated: When he has come to the monastery, he should make a mandala.🔽Placing the alms-bowl without handle in front of him, he should eat the food consecrated in the alms-bowl.

original: zos zin nas byi dor dang kha zas 'babs pa'i dril phyis bya ba yang dang por lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: zos zin nas byi dor dang kha zas 'babs pa'i dril phyis bya ba yang dang por lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: When he has finished eating, he should clean up and wipe the table. First he should put away the alms-bowl without handle.

original: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa la bya'o //
translated: Then he should put away the consecrated alms-bowl.

original: bkru ba dang / skam pa dang / lcibs brud pa la yang de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: bkru ba dang / skam pa dang / lcibs brud pa la yang de bzhin bya'o //
translated: He should do the same with the washing, drying, and polishing.

original: gal te lhung bzed kyi ngos khung gnyis yod na bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te lhung bzed kyi ngos khung gnyis yod na bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: If the alms-bowl has two sides, he should put the alms-bowl without handle on the better side.

original: cig shos su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should put the consecrated alms-bowl on the other side.

original: gal te ngos khung gcig yod la /
analyzed: gal te ngos khung gcig yod la /
translated: If the alms-bowl has only one side,

original: gal te shod khung bzang na shod du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te shod khung bzang na shod du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: If the lower part is better, then place the unrelated alms-bowl in the lower part.

original: ngos khung lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ngos khung lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Place the consecrated alms-bowl in the upper part.

original: gal te ngos khung bzang na ngos khung du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te ngos khung bzang na ngos khung du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: If the upper part is better, then place the unrelated alms-bowl in the upper part.

original: shod du lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: shod du lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Place the consecrated alms-bowl in the lower part.

original: lhung bzed kyi las byed pa na gal te rdza bo gnyis yod na rdza bo bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bsreg par bya zhing /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi las byed pa na gal te rdza bo gnyis yod na rdza bo bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bsreg par bya zhing /
translated: When performing the alms-bowl ritual, if there are two clay pots, then burn the unrelated alms-bowl in the better clay pot.

original: cig shos su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos su lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bsreg par bya'o //
translated: Burn the consecrated alms-bowl in the other one.

original: gal te rdza bo gcig yod na gal te 'og tu bzhag pas legs par chos par gyur na 'og tu lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te rdza bo gcig yod na gal te 'og tu bzhag pas legs par chos par gyur na 'og tu lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: If there is only one clay pot, if it is good to place it below, then place the unrelated alms-bowl below.

original: steng du lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: steng du lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Place the consecrated alms-bowl above.

original: gal te steng du bzhag pa legs par chos par 'gyur na steng du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te steng du bzhag pa legs par chos par 'gyur na steng du lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: If it is better to place it above, then place the unblessed begging bowl above.

original: 'og tu lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Place the blessed begging bowl below.

original: lam du 'gro na lhung bzed kyi snod gnyis bkur bar bya ste /
analyzed: lam du 'gro na lhung bzed kyi snod gnyis bkur bar bya ste /
translated: When going on the road, carry two begging bowls.

original: de la bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing /🔽cig shos su lhung bzed @156a * //
analyzed: de la bzang po gang yin pa der lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gzhug par bya zhing / cig shos su lhung bzed @156a * //
translated: Place the unblessed begging bowl in the better of the two.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Place the blessed begging bowl in the other.

original: gal te khur rtsa ba 'ga' zhig yod na de la lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bkur bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te khur rtsa ba 'ga' zhig yod na de la lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bkur bar bya zhing /
translated: If you have a load on your back, carry the blessed begging bowl on that.

original: bdag nyid kyis lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bkur bar bya'o //
translated: Carry the unblessed begging bowl yourself.

original: gal te khur rtsa ba 'ga' yang med na phrag pa g-yon bas lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bkur bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te khur rtsa ba 'ga' yang med na phrag pa g-yon bas lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa bkur bar bya zhing /
translated: If you have no load on your back, carry the unblessed begging bowl on your left shoulder.

original: phrag pa g-yas pas lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: phrag pa g-yas pas lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa bkur bar bya'o //
translated: Carry the blessed begging bowl on your right shoulder.

original: 'di ni de'i chad pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i chad pa'i las yin te /
translated: This is the downfall of abandoning the training.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par rjes su srung bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par rjes su srung bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep the training as long as one lives by properly guarding morality.

original: de ni lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa 'brim pa bsko ba'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa 'brim pa bsko ba'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and action of appointing a monk to carry the alms bowl.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na spang ba'i lhung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i skabs na dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'i skabs nas yang dge slong gang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsgyur du 'jug na spang ba'i lhung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i skabs na dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus
translated: In the context of the topic of the offense of changing a dedication, it says, “If a monk, knowing that an object has been dedicated to the saṅgha, causes it to be changed to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”🔽In the Questions of the Son of the Brahmin Lady,

original: pa las ; gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pa 'bul bar byed na dge slong de gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: pa las ; gnas gang na dge slong gcig pu zhig gnas pa der sbyin bdag gis dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pa 'bul bar byed na dge slong de gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: it says, “In a place where there is only one monk, if a donor offers an object for the saṅgha, that single monk should consecrate the object.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: If he appropriates it without consecrating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni bdag gnas 'di na gcig pu gnas te /
analyzed: gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni bdag gnas 'di na gcig pu gnas te /
translated: “I, a monk, am staying alone in this place.

original: dge 'dun la gos kyi rnyed pa 'di byung bas bdag gis gos 'di nyams su blang ngo //🔽dus su byin gyis brlab bo zhes lan gsum sems bskyed par bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun la gos kyi rnyed pa 'di byung bas bdag gis gos 'di nyams su blang ngo // dus su byin gyis brlab bo zhes lan gsum sems bskyed par bya /
translated: This acquisition of cloth has arisen for the saṅgha. I will use this cloth.🔽I consecrate it in a timely way.”

original: tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should generate this thought three times and express it in words.

original: de ni gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni gcig pus rnyed pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual and mantra for consecrating the acquisition of a single monk.🔽The prohibition against changing the dedication:

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba de nyid kyi skabs nas dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam shi'am spyugs na dge slong dag gis gtsug lag khang de yal bar mi 'dor bar dge slong gang gtsug
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba de nyid kyi skabs nas dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam shi'am spyugs na dge slong dag gis gtsug lag khang de yal bar mi 'dor bar dge slong gang gtsug
translated: In the context of the same topic, in the Questions of the Son of a Brahmin Sūtra, it says that if the owner of a temple is killed, bound, dies, or is exiled, the monks should not abandon that temple.

original: lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa /
analyzed: lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa /
translated: A monk who has a strong attachment to that temple🔽should consecrate it as his own.

original: de der srung mar bzhag cing der dge 'dun dang sbyin bdag dus sum lhags na dge slong des lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de der srung mar bzhag cing der dge 'dun dang sbyin bdag dus sum lhags na dge slong des lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: He should live there for five years, passing the time on alms-food.

original: lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'tsho ba thun @156b mong du bya bas 'da' bar bya zhing gtsug lag khang de dang nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang der rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya'o
analyzed: lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'tsho ba thun @156b mong du bya bas 'da' bar bya zhing gtsug lag khang de dang nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang der rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya'o
translated: For the next five years he should live in common with the community of monks in the neighboring monastery. The gains of that monastery and the neighboring monastery are to be shared in common, but the poṣadha ceremony is to be performed separately.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done.

original: des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas ;
analyzed: des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas ;
translated: He should prepare the sleeping place, ring the gandi, and inform the monks with the announcement.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: When the entire Saṅgha is present and agrees, a monk should make a motion and perform the procedure.

original: des 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: des 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: He should do it like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, he should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable monks, please listen!

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag bo bcom mam /🔽bcings sam / gum mam /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag bo bcom mam / bcings sam / gum mam /
translated: If the owner of this monastery has been killed,🔽imprisoned, killed, or exiled, if the time has come for the Saṅgha and the Saṅgha agrees, may the Saṅgha allow it.

original: spyugs na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad par mdzad do //
analyzed: spyugs na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad par mdzad do //
translated: The Saṅgha will make the gains of this and the other monastery common, and the observance-day ceremony separate.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o ;
translated: This is the motion.

original: / las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: / las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is done like this.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable monks, please listen!

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam /
translated: If the owner of this monastery has been killed,

original: bcings sam / gum mam /
analyzed: bcings sam / gum mam /
translated: imprisoned, killed, or exiled,

original: spyugs te / de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong gi tha dad du mdzad kyis /
analyzed: spyugs te / de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong gi tha dad du mdzad kyis /
translated: for that reason the Saṅgha will make the gains of this and the other monastery common, and the observance-day ceremony separate.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge🔽'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas ;
translated: Those who agree that the gains of this and that monastery are to be shared in common, but that the poṣadha is to be performed separately, should remain silent. Those who do not agree, should speak.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad lags te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha gi ba'i rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad lags te /
translated: The second announcement is made in the same way, and then the abbot says, The Saṅgha has agreed to the gains of this and that monastery being shared in common, but that the poṣadha is to be performed separately.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since there is no objection, this will stand thus.

original: de ni gtsug lag khang gnyis gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong du bya ba'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni gtsug lag khang gnyis gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong du bya ba'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the rite and procedure for two monasteries to have separate poṣadhas but to share gains in common.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi skabs nas yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i zhar la dge slong dang dge slong ma
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed kyi skabs nas yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba brjod na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i zhar la dge slong dang dge slong ma
translated: If a fully ordained monk reveals the downfall of evil states to one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct unless the saṅgha has given permission.🔽In the context of this rule, the Buddha said:

original: sdig can dag khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong @157a * //
analyzed: sdig can dag khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong @157a * //
translated: “Monks and nuns who are evildoers should be appointed by the saṅgha to go to the houses of the faithful.”

original: bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bsko bar bya ste /🔽khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya la /
analyzed: bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bsko bar bya ste / khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar mi bya la /
translated: The way to appoint them is as follows.

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: A monk who is to be appointed to go to the houses of the faithful should have five qualities. If he does not have these qualities, he should not be appointed, and if he has been appointed, he should be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / go bar byas pa dang ma byas pa'i khyim mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba dang / go bar byas pa dang ma byas pa'i khyim mi shes pa'o //
translated: He goes out of desire, hatred, ignorance, and fear, and he does not know which houses have already been visited and which have not.

original: khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
analyzed: khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed pa'i dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa ni ma bskos pa yang bsko bar bya la /
translated: A monk who has five qualities, who is not appointed to inform the houses individually, should be appointed.

original: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: bskos pa yang dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: And one who is appointed should not be dismissed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs bas mi 'gro ba dang / go bar byas pa dang ma byas ba'i khyim shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas mi 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang gis mi 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis mi 'gro ba dang / 'jigs bas mi 'gro ba dang / go bar byas pa dang ma byas ba'i khyim shes pa'o //
translated: He does not go out of desire, he does not go out of hatred, he does not go out of confusion, he does not go out of fear, and he knows the houses that have been informed and those that have not.

original: 'di ltar bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsko bar bya'o //
translated: He should be appointed like this.

original: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: je dang por spro bar bya ste /
translated: First he should be encouraged:

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par spro'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba khyod dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par spro'am zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Monk so-and-so, are you able to inform the houses individually, together with the newly ordained monk and the nun Uppalavaṇṇā?”

original: gal te sbron des spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sbron des spro'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he agrees, he should say, “I’m able.”

original: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te /
translated: After that, he should prepare a seat, ring the gandi,

original: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: Having instructed the monks with the words of the inquiry,

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la /
translated: when the entire Saṅgha is seated and has reached consensus,

original: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //
translated: a single monk should make the motion and perform the procedure.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should sit and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable members of the Saṅgha, please listen!

original: dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid de /
analyzed: dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma ci nas kyang skye bo phal po che'i tshogs ma dad par rig par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyim rnams su spyod par bgyid de /
translated: The monk Aśvaka and the nun Selamā are acting in such a way that a great multitude of people will come to lack faith.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par spro na /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par spro na /
translated: If this monk so-and-so is willing to inform the households of the monk Aśvaka and the nun Selamā,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bsko ste /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid par bsko ste /
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, the Saṅgha should agree to appoint the monk so-and-so as the one who informs households.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid do //
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'di dge slong 'phral ba dang dge slong ma gsal ma khyim rnams su so sor go bar bgyid do //
translated: The monk so-and-so is willing to inform households about the monk so-and-so and the nun so-and-so.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di @157b ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di @157b ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /

analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //

analyzed: de ni dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko ba'i cho ga dang las so //

translated: The section on the downfall of eating in a group of more than four monks also mentions to make it into leftovers. This is how it should be done:

original: / dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug pa byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba'am bza' ba rnyed cing za bar 'dod na dge slong des lag pa gnyis bsnyal te byin len byas la /

translated: “If a monk, having finished his meal and having refused an invitation to eat more, has obtained some food that is not left over, and if he wishes to eat it, that monk should wash his hands, receive the food,

analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam @161a * // las ma nyams pa gang yin pa'am /

translated: If a monk who has eaten and not rejected food, but has not yet risen from his seat, should say, “Eat the leftovers!” then he may eat two or three mouthfuls.

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bza' bar mi bya bar lag par byin nas khyod kyir gyur gyi bzhud cig ces brjod pas lhag por bya'o ;

translated: If a monk who has eaten and rejected food, but has not yet risen from his seat, should say, “Eat the leftovers!” then he may eat as much as he can hold in his cupped hands.

original: / de ni lhag por bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: / de ni lhag por bya ba'i cho ga dang sngags so //

analyzed: dge slong 'ga' la sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di byung ste ;

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /

translated: saying,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //

analyzed: 'chi ltas bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams ni bar du gcod pa nyid do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar gsungs te /

analyzed: de dag @161b bsten na bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis /
translated: If you rely on them, they will be obstacles.🔽Therefore, you should abandon this sinful view.

analyzed: 'chi ltas khyod sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig / de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //
translated: This is the first step.🔽If the monks admonish him, and he still insists on his view, holding firmly to it and declaring, “This alone is true, all else is false,”

translated: then the monks should admonish him a second and a third time, telling him to give up that view.🔽If he does not give up that view after being admonished a third time, he commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽The monks should first try to get him to see things the right way.

analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //

translated: If the Saṅgha judges that the time is right and approves, let the Saṅgha agree to the following: The Saṅgha should admonish the monk Aśbhaka in this way: ‘Do not say, “I understand the doctrine taught by the Blessed One in such a way that those things that the Blessed One has said are obstacles are not obstacles at all.

translated: In the context of the very same offense of not giving up a view, it is said, “The sinful monk who does not give up a view should be reproved.” This is how it is done.

translated: This is the rite and procedure for censuring a sinful monk who does not relinquish his distorted view.

translated: The section on the downfall of evicting a monk who is trying to make amends states that a sinful novice should be expelled if he does not relinquish his distorted view. The procedure is as follows:

analyzed: dge tshul gang la sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dag ni bar du gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /

translated: Do not say, ‘We know the Dharma taught by the Blessed One.’ Do not denigrate the Blessed One, for it will not turn out well if you denigrate him.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //

analyzed: te ; de dag bsten na bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis /

analyzed: tsher ma dang chen po pa khyed gnyis sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig / de ni dus dang por bya ba'o //

analyzed: // 'di ltar bsgo bar bya ste /

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dag ni bar du gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te ;

analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag gis shes so zhes mchi nas /

analyzed: 'di gnyis la dge slong rab tu mang pos bzhams te bsgo na /

translated: They say, “Venerables, we see no fault in these things that you see as faults.🔽Venerables, you see faults in things that are not faults.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag cag gis shes so zhes de skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pa ma @164b 'debs shig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pas legs par mi 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //

original: de dag bsten na bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: de dag bsten na bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis /

original: tsher ma dang chen po pa khyed gnyis sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo ba mdzad do //

analyzed: de skad ces bsgo ba na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /

analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dag ni bar du gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag gis shes so zhes mchi nas /

analyzed: 'di gnyis la dge slong rab tu mang pos bzhams te bsgo na /

original: 'di gnyis la bzhams te bsgo yang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa de nyid la nan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs na /

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dag ni bar du gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa dag ni bar du gcod pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‘Kaṭa and Mahānāma, the Blessed One has said that desires are an obstacle, but even if we pursue them, they will not be an obstacle.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag cag gis shes so zhes de skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pa ma 'debs shig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pas legs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag cag gis shes so zhes de skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pa ma 'debs shig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pas legs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We understand the Dharma taught by the Blessed One in this way.’ Do not say that! Do not denigrate the Blessed One! It is not good to denigrate the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One would not say that.
